methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary: Execute a new message call
methods.description:
This request executes a new message call without creating a transaction on the blockchain. It allows you to invoke a contract function locally to interact with smart contracts and query data without modifying the blockchain state or consuming gas. `eth_call` is ideal for retrieving data, simulating transactions, or testing contract interactions. 
You may (optionally) specify a block identifier to simulate the transaction on, or estimate gas usage based on the state of the blockchain at that block.
If the execution continues beyond the gas cap (10x the block gas limit), the node stops the simulation and returns an error. This prevents demand for excessive computational resource use or API abuse.

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete.
methods.description:
Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete. The transaction will not be added to the blockchain. Note that the estimate may be significantly more than the amount of gas actually used by the transaction, for a variety of reasons including EVM mechanics and node performance.

To prevent abuse of the API, the `gas` parameter in this `eth_estimateGas` method and in `eth_call` is capped at 10x (1000%) the current block gas limit. You can recreate this behavior in your local test environment (Besu, geth, or other client) using the [`rpc.gascap`](https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/fundamentals/command-line-options#commands) command line option.

methods.name: eth_feeHistory
methods.summary: Transaction fee history
methods.description: Returns transaction base fee per gas and effective priority fee per gas for the requested/supported block range.

params.name: blockCount
params.description: Hexadecimal or decimal integer of the number of blocks for which historical fee data is required; up to maximum of 1024 blocks. Clients will return less than the requested range if not all blocks are available.

params.name: newestBlock
params.description: Hexadecimal or decimal integer representing the highest number block of the requested range, or one of the string tags. Defines the starting point for fetching fee history information. The history will go from this point backward to the provided blockCount, if that data is available.

oneOf.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.
oneOf.title: Block number

params.name: rewardPercentiles
params.description: Pass empty array if this request is not required. An ordered array of integers of reward percentile values; from smallest to largest as floating point value between 0 and 100. For each block in the requested range, the transactions are sorted in ascending order by effective tip per gas and the corresponding effective tip for the percentile then determined, accounting for gas consumed.

result.name: Fee history result
result.description: Fee history for the returned block range. This can be a subsection of the requested range if not all blocks are available.

oldestBlock.description: Lowest number block of returned range.
oldestBlock.title: oldestBlock

baseFeePerGas.title: baseFeePerGasArray
baseFeePerGas.description: An array of block base fees per gas. This includes the next block after the newest of the returned range, because this value can be derived from the newest block. Zeroes are returned for pre-EIP-1559 blocks.

baseFeePerBlobGas.title: baseFeePerBlobGasArray
baseFeePerBlobGas.description: An array of block base fees per blob gas. This includes the next block after the newest of the returned range, because this value can be derived from the newest block. Zeroes are returned for pre-EIP-4844 blocks.

gasUsedRatio.title: gasUsedRatio
gasUsedRatio.description: An array of block gas used ratios. These are calculated as the ratio of gasUsed and gasLimit.

blobGasUsedRatio.title: blobGasUsedRatio
blobGasUsedRatio.description: An array of block blob gas used ratios. These are calculated as the ratio of blobGasUsed and the max blob gas per block.

reward.title: rewardArray
reward.description: A two-dimensional array of effective priority fees per gas at the requested block percentiles.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: An array of effective priority fee per gas data points from a single block. All zeroes are returned if the block is empty.
A given percentile sample of effective priority fees per gas from a single block in ascending order, weighted by gas used. Zeroes are returned if the block is empty.
items.title: rewardPercentile

methods.name: eth_getBlockByNumber
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by number.
methods.description: Returns information about a block given its block number.

oneOf.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.
oneOf.title: Block number

schema.title: hydrated
schema.description: If `true`, returns full transaction objects; if `false`, returns only transaction hashes.

result.name: Block information
result.description: Block object matching the given block number, or `null` when no block was found.

hash.description: Block hash, 32 byte hex identifier for the block derived from the block header.

parentHash.description: 32 byte hex value of the hash of the parent block.

sha3Uncles.description: SHA3 of the uncle's data in the block.

miner.description: Not relevant to Proof of Stake. Applied to Proof of Work. Address to pay mining rewards to the coinbase transaction that rewarded the miner for their work.

stateRoot.description: Root of the final state trie for the block as 32 byte hex value.

transactionsRoot.description: Root of the transaction trie for the block.

receiptsRoot.description: Root of the receipts trie for the block.

logsBloom.description: Bloom filter for the block logs; `null` when block is pending.

difficulty.description: Not relevant to Proof of Stake. Difficulty for this block.

number.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.

gasLimit.description: Maximum gas allowed in this block.

gasUsed.description: Total gas used by all transactions in this block.

extraData.description: Extra data field for this block.

mixHash.description: Not relevant to Proof of Stake. Hash used in the Proof of Work process.

nonce.description: Proof of Work nonce; not relevant to Proof of Stake. Hash of the generated Proof of Work.

totalDifficulty.description: Not relevant to Proof of Stake. Total difficulty of the chain until this block. This value will always be `0` for an uncle block.

baseFeePerGas.description: The block's base fee per gas; empty for blocks created before [EIP-1559](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1559.md).

withdrawalsRoot.description: Root of the trie containing withdrawal receipts in the block.

blobGasUsed.description: Total blob gas used in the block. Relevant to data availability and EIP-4844 (blob transactions).

excessBlobGas.description: Excess blob gas that's carried over to the next block. Relevant for managing the blob gas market introduced in EIP-4844.

parentBeaconBlockRoot.description: Root of the parent Beacon Chain block. This ties the execution layer to the consensus layer in Proof of Stake.

size.description: Array of transaction objects, or 32 byte transaction hashes depending on the specified parameter.

methods.name: eth_getBlockReceipts
methods.summary: Returns the receipts of a block by number or hash.
methods.description: Returns all transaction receipts for a given block, the amount of gas used, and any event logs that might have been produced by a smart contract during the transactions.

schema.description: Block number, tag, or block hash.

anyOf.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.

result.name: Receipts information
result.description: Array of receipt objects for the specified block, or `null` when no block was found.

type.description: Hex-encoded byte.

transactionHash.description: The transaction hash in which the call was made.

transactionIndex.description: A hexadecimal of the integer representing the position in the block.

blockHash.description: Block hash; 32 byte hex identifier for the block derived from the block header.

blockNumber.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.

to.description: Address of the receiver or null in a contract creation transaction.

cumulativeGasUsed.description: The sum of gas used by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.

gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used for this specific transaction alone.

blobGasUsed.description: The amount of blob gas used for this specific transaction. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

transactionIndex.description: A hexadecimal of the integer representing the position in the block.

transactionHash.description: The transaction hash in which the call was made.

blockHash.description: Block hash; 32 byte hex identifier for the block derived from the block header.

blockNumber.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.

root.description: The post-transaction state root. Only specified for transactions included before the Byzantium upgrade.

status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure). Only specified for transactions included after the Byzantium upgrade.

effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account. Before EIP-1559, this is equal to the transaction's gas price. After, it is equal to baseFeePerGas + min(maxFeePerGas - baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas).

blobGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account for blob gas. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

transactionIndex.description: A hexadecimal of the integer representing the position in the block.

methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching the specified filter.
methods.description: Returns logs that match the provided filter object parameters (`address`, `fromBlock`, `toBlock`, `topics`).

fromBlock.description: A hexadecimal block number, or one of the string tags latest, earliest, pending, safe, or finalized.

oneOf.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.
oneOf.title: Block number

toBlock.description: A hexadecimal block number, or one of the string tags latest, earliest, pending, safe, or finalized.

oneOf.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.
oneOf.title: Block number

address.description: A contract address or a list of addresses from which logs should originate.

topics.description: An array of 32 bytes DATA topics. Topics are order-dependent. `null` (empty array) provides any topic match.

methods.name: eth_getProof
methods.description: Returns the Merkle proof for an account and optional storage keys per EIP-1186.
methods.summary: Returns the merkle proof for a given account and optionally some storage keys.

params.name: Address
params.description: A string identifier for the contract or EOA address (20 bytes).

params.name: StorageKeys
params.description: Storage keys may be specified to retrieve the storage proofs for particular slots in a smart contract's storage. If not required, pass empty array.

schema.description: Block number, tag, or block hash.

anyOf.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.

result.name: Account
result.description: Account proof object containing account and storage proofs.

address.description: The account address for which the Merkle proof is retrieved. This is an echo of the address passed in the request.

accountProof.description: An array of RLP-serialized MerkleTree-Nodes, starting with the `stateRoot`-Node, following the path of the address as key.

balance.description: Hexadecimal of the balance in wei.

codeHash.description: The 32-byte hash of the account's code. For EOAs, this will be the hash of an empty string. For contract accounts, it represents the hash of the deployed contract code.

nonce.description: Account nonce; counter for the number of transactions sent from the account; for replay protection.

storageHash.description: 32-byte SHA3 hash of the storage root. All storage will deliver a Merkle proof starting with this root hash.

proof.description: An array of RLP-serialized MerkleTree-Nodes, starting with the `storageHash` node and following the path of the key.

schema.description: Block number, tag, or block hash.

anyOf.description: Block number as hex-encoded unsigned integer.

result.name: Value
result.description: Hex-encoded value stored at the given slot.

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction
methods.summary: Submits a raw transaction.
methods.description:
You can create and sign a transaction externally using a library such as [web3.js](https://web3js.readthedocs.io/) or [ethers.js](https://docs.ethers.org/).
For [EIP-4844](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4844) transactions, the raw form must be the network form. This means it includes the blobs, KZG commitments, and KZG proofs.
Submits a pre-signed transaction for broadcast to the Ethereum network.
Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) protection is available for all Infura customers on Mainnet. This means `r`, `s`, and `v` signature fields might return empty hex values (0x0) while the transaction is pending on Mainnet.

result.name: Transaction hash
result.description: 32-byte hash of the broadcast transaction, or the zero hash if not yet available.

methods.name: eth_sendTransaction
methods.summary: Signs and submits a transaction.
methods.description: Signs a transaction with an unlocked account on the client and broadcasts it to the network.

params.name: Transaction
params.description: Transaction call object to be signed and sent.

schema.description: Transaction object generic to all supported transactions. All transaction call object parameters are optional.

type.description:
Hex-encoded byte for transaction type as introduced in EIP-2718. Use:
- 0x00 for LegacyTxType
- 0x01 for AccessListTxType
- 0x02 for DynamicFeeTxType
- 0x03 for BlobTxType

nonce.description: Account nonce; counter for the number of transactions sent from the account; for replay protection.

to.description: The recipient's address. `null` when it's a contract creation transaction.

gas.description: Gas provided by the sender. `eth_call` consumes zero gas, but this schema supports other executions that might need this parameter. `eth_estimateGas` ignores this value.

value.description: Value sent with this transaction in wei.

methods.name: eth_subscribe
methods.summary: Creates a new subscription.
methods.description:
Creates a new subscription for particular events. The node returns a subscription ID. For each event that matches the subscription, a notification with relevant data is sent together with the subscription ID.
We strongly recommend specifying a filter (`address` or `topics` or both) when subscribing to the `logs` event.

oneOf.title: newHeads
oneOf.description: Subscribing to this returns a notification each time a new header is appended to the chain, including chain reorganizations. In a chain reorganization, the subscription emits all new headers for the new chain. Therefore the subscription can emit multiple headers at the same height.

oneOf.title: logs
oneOf.description: Returns logs that are included in new imported blocks and match the given filter criteria. In case of a chain reorganization, previously sent logs that are on the old chain are resent with the removed property set to true. Logs from transactions that ended up in the new chain are emitted. Therefore a subscription can emit logs for the same transaction multiple times. This parameter has the following fields.

address.description: Either an address or an array of addresses. Only logs that are created from these addresses are returned.

topics.description: Only logs which match the specified topics (optional).

oneOf.title: newPendingTransactions
oneOf.description: Returns the hash for all transactions that are added to the pending state and are signed with a key that's available in the node. When a transaction that was previously part of the canonical chain isn't part of the new canonical chain after a reorganization, it's emitted again.

result.name: Subscription ID
result.description: The ID of the newly created subscription on the node.

methods.name: pimlico_getUserOperationStatus
methods.summary: Returns the user operation status.
methods.description: Returns the user operation status and, optionally, the transaction hash that the bundler is using to bundle the user operation onchain. The transaction hash returned when the result is submitted can change if the bundler resubmits the user operation inside a different transaction.

params.name: userOpHash
params.description: The 32-byte hash of the user operation to check the status for.

result.name: status
result.description: An object containing the status information.

status.description:
The current status of the user operation:
- not_found: Unknown to the bundler or rejected during validation
- not_submitted: In mempool but not yet bundled
- submitted: Bundled into a pending transaction
- rejected: Re-simulation failed during bundling
- included: Successfully included onchain
- failed: Transaction reverted
- queued: Waiting due to high nonce

transactionHash.description: The transaction hash bundling the user operation, or null if not applicable.

methods.description: Returns transaction processing trace information for the specified transaction. Use this method to improve smart contract performance by analyzing its internal transactions and execution steps. BlockTag.description:
Descriptor of block by status. See the [default block parameter](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#default-block).
  - `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available.
  - `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination. 
  - `safe`: The most recent block that's safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions. 
  - `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the
  canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions. 
  - `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool.

status.description:
The current status of the user operation:
- not_found: Unknown to the bundler or rejected during validation
- not_submitted: In mempool but not yet bundled
- submitted: Bundled into a pending transaction
- rejected: Re-simulation failed during bundling
- included: Successfully included onchain
- failed: Transaction reverted
- queued: Waiting due to high nonce

blobGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account for blob gas. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

address.description: The account address for which the Merkle proof is retrieved. This is an echo of the address passed in the request.

accountProof.description: An array of RLP-serialized MerkleTree-Nodes, starting with the `stateRoot`-Node, following the path of the address as key.

balance.description: Hexadecimal of the balance in wei.

codeHash.description: The 32-byte hash of the account's code. For EOAs, this will be the hash of an empty string. For contract accounts, it represents the hash of the deployed contract code.

nonce.description: Account nonce; counter for the number of transactions sent from the account; for replay protection.

storageHash.description: 32-byte SHA3 hash of the storage root. All storage will deliver a Merkle proof starting with this root hash.

proof.description: An array of RLP-serialized MerkleTree-Nodes, starting with the `storageHash` node and following the path of the key.
An array of RLP-serialized MerkleTree-Nodes, starting with the `storageHash` node and following the path of the key.

Trace.description: Trace object representing a call or operation during transaction execution.

creationMethod.description: Opcode used during contract creation (`create` or `create2`).

input.description: Transaction data (for call operations).

to.description: Target address of the transaction.

blockHash.description: Hash of the block containing this trace.

blockNumber.description: Block number containing this trace.

result.description: Transaction result.

address.description: Address of the newly created contract (for create operations).

code.description: Bytecode of the newly created contract (for create operations).

gasUsed.description: Gas used by the transaction.

output.description: Return value of the contract call.

traceAddress.description: Tree list address of where the call occurred.

transactionHash.description: Hash of the transaction.

type.description: Type of operation (`call`, `create`, `selfdestruct`, `reward`).

type.description:
Hex-encoded byte for transaction type as introduced in EIP-2718. Use:
- 0x00 for LegacyTxType
- 0x01 for AccessListTxType
- 0x02 for DynamicFeeTxType
- 0x03 for BlobTxType

nonce.description: Account nonce; counter for the number of transactions sent from the account; for replay protection.

to.description: The recipient's address. `null` when it's a contract creation transaction.

gas.description: Gas provided by the sender. `eth_call` consumes zero gas, but this schema supports other executions that might need this parameter. `eth_estimateGas` ignores this value.

value.description: Value sent with this transaction in wei.

input.description: Alternative term for `data`. The hash of the method signature and encoded parameters. For more information, see the Contract ABI description in the Solidity documentation.

gasPrice.description: The gas price the sender is willing to pay in wei. Used only in non-[EIP-1559](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1559.md) transactions.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee, in wei, the sender is willing to pay per gas above the base fee. Can be used only in [EIP-1559 transactions](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1559.md). If used, must specify `maxFeePerGas`.

maxFeePerGas.description: Maximum total fee (base fee + priority fee), in wei, the sender is willing to pay per gas. Can be used only in [EIP-1559 transactions](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1559.md). If used, must specify `maxPriorityFeePerGas`.

maxFeePerBlobGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay for blob gas in wei.

accessList.description: EIP-2930 access list; a list of addresses and storage keys that the transaction plans to access.

blobVersionedHashes.description: List of versioned blob hashes associated with the transaction's EIP-4844 data blobs.

chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

Bespoke.name: Bespoke
Bespoke.description: Custom APIs built for specific clients or highly specialized use cases or clients; not available as standard EVM or MetaMask methods.

OpenBeta.name: Beta
OpenBeta.description: Available as a beta version; use at your own risk.

CustomPlan.name: Custom plan
CustomPlan.description: Infura's advanced API methods offered through custom arrangements.

DINParther.name: DIN
DINParther.description: Infura's DIN partners support the network.

Ethereum.name: EVM
Ethereum.description:
Ethereum execution API methods. These methods cover basic transaction calls, block information, and account management available in Ethereum's [`execution-apis`](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/) repository.
These are standard Ethereum JSON-RPC API methods. See the [Ethereum wiki](https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#json-rpc-methods) for more information about these methods."

Experimental.name: Experimental
Experimental.description: Publicly available but may not be stable or fully supported; experimental. Methods may have limited support and could change or be deprecated. Users are advised to use these at their own risk.

PaidPlan.name: Paid plan
PaidPlan.description: Infura's paid plans giving access to advanced API methods that offer extended functionality such as access to archive data, IPFS gateway, and specialized performance optimizations.

WSS.name: WebSocket
WSS.description: WebSocket requests are supported in Linea via a virtualization service. An alternative, dedicated URL must be applied.
